image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: Twenty-six years after Phyllis Harrison was stabbed to death at her home in Adelaide's north, her family have given evidence in the trial of her alleged killer, accused triple-murderer Steven Leslie Hainsworth.

title.children: 11yo boy found grandmother's murdered body, court hears

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks in front of a Government of South Australia banner

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide Football Club chair David Koch has issued a call for SA's two AFL clubs to work together to take the "nastiness" out of the Showdown, after last weekend's match was marred by incidents both on and off the field.

title.children: Power and Crows should take 'the sting out of the Showdown', Koch says

image.altText: A firefighter regards a small four-wheel drive that has crashed through the wall of a building.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the cause of a crash that left the hospital south of Adelaide badly damaged and four people with minor injuries.

title.children: Car crashes into Victor Harbor hospital moments after worker leaves desk

image.altText: A man, two teenage boys and a woman smile on a football field. One boy holds a footy.

props.synopsis: Former premiership captain Mark Bickley was no stranger to concussions but after his son was in a bike accident, he realised head injuries could present differently in children.

title.children: 'I thought we'd lost the Xavier we knew': Ex-AFL player shares son's concussion experience

image.altText: A man wearing a hoody and cap standing on an open suburban street.

props.synopsis: Despite finding an online audience, the Mount Gambier rapper says finding somewhere to play live in regional South Australia has been a battle. He hopes new local music initiatives will change that.

title.children: Nic has thousands of views online, but he's only ever performed in his hometown once

image.altText: A man with a beard holds a young child with houses in the background

props.synopsis: Edward Gilmore hoped to be living in his new home by the time his first-born child was ready to take his first steps. Four years after he signed the contract – and with an extra child now in tow – his family are finally moving in.

title.children: First home buyers left in the lurch after building company collapse finally moving in

image.altText: A destroyed combat vehicles sits n the side of the road, alongside other destroyed cars.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian forces are believed to have used Australian-supplied Bushmasters as part of their recent surprise incursion into Russia, with evidence emerging of at least one of the armoured vehicles apparently destroyed inside the western border region of Kursk.

title.children: Burnt-out Bushmaster apparently found in Kursk after incursion into Russian territory

image.altText: Cronin gestures with both hands while standing on a stage.

props.synopsis: The first annual update on the progress of the National Plan to End Violence Against Women and Children has been handed to parliament, with a promise by government to act on the plan.

title.children: First update on plan to end violence against women notes progress but raises serious concerns

image.altText: A man and a woman hug

props.synopsis: After some hiccups on the first day, organisers of the Democratic National Convention brought out the big guns for day two: The Obamas and a dance party. Here's what you missed.

title.children: At the DNC, Michelle Obama dumps 'when they go low, we go high' for something more pointed against Trump

image.altText: A close-up of a cotton plant surrounded by dry ground.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has rejected accusations it is flouting its own land and water laws to facilitate a new cotton industry, as calls grow for a federal inquiry.

title.children: NT government defends cotton industry's land and water use amid calls for federal inquiry

image.altText: Close up portrait of blond shorthaired woman with glasses

props.synopsis: News Corporation journalist Samantha Maiden gives evidence in the defamation action launched by Linda Reynolds against Brittany Higgins over a series of social media posts the senator believes were defamatory.

title.children: 'Greatest moments in journalism': Texts between Brittany Higgins and reporter who broke story aired

image.altText: A drone image shows a bridge that has been severely damaged.

props.synopsis: Over four days, all three bridges over the Seym River in Kursk were either destroyed or damaged, as Ukraine's incursion into Russian territory enters its third week.

title.children: Ukraine strikes three key bridges in Russian territory, creating a 'very difficult' situation for Moscow

image.altText: Four young children smiling and laughing

props.synopsis: Charmaine McLeod and her two daughters, Aaleyn, 6, and Matilda, 5, and her two sons Wyatt, 4, and Zaidok, 2, died in a highway collision near Kingaroy on May 27, 2019.

title.children: Queensland mother found to have deliberately killed her four children in highway crash

image.altText: A man standing in front of vine leaves making a gesture with his hands on top of each other

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has found two men guilty of murdering another man in Adelaide's CBD in the early hours of Anzac Day 2022.

title.children: Pair found guilty of stabbing and stomping murder in Adelaide CBD

image.altText: Three miners in hi-vis workwear walking out of yellow lift pointing to a crowd.

props.synopsis: For a fortnight, Todd Russell and Brant Webb lay side-by-side, trapped in a small dark space, after a mine collapse. Until the last minute, they were never certain they'd survive.

title.children: A miner survived 14 days trapped underground. When he got out, he was not prepared for becoming a household name

image.altText: A stylised image of a mother cradling a baby.

props.synopsis: Leaked documents obtained by ABC News show child protection workers regularly breached government policy when removing newborns at one of Adelaide's public maternity hospitals.

title.children: Midwives ordered to stop mothers breastfeeding before 'unethical' newborn removals, documents reveal

image.altText: CSIRO scientist in lab

props.synopsis: An estimated 200 scientific roles have already been earmarked for axing as the union says the move is a "dark day" for science.

title.children: CSIRO to cut up to 500 jobs as part of agency restructure

image.altText: A woman sitting on a footstool in front of a couch smiles at the camerra.

props.synopsis: The Canberra centre offers up to 12 people with common eating disorders like anorexia nervosa, bulimia and binge-eating disorder 24/7 sub-acute care from a multidisciplinary team.

title.children: Gardening, cooking and music among therapies to help eating disorder patients at Australian-first treatment centre

image.altText: Maddy MacRae poses leaning against the railing of a boat, smiling and waving, in front Sydney Opera House.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Content creator Maddy MacRae answers all the money questions we don't like to talk about as we seek to demystify personal finance and normalise conversations about how we think about money, what we earn and how we spend it.

title.children: $15k in debt and out of work, Maddy started posting on TikTok — then it changed her life

image.altText: Generic image of a JetStar plane

props.synopsis: Jetstar faces a class action over cancelled flights during the COVID-19 pandemic, with its flight credits program under scrutiny.

title.children: Jetstar faces class action over cancelled flights during the COVID-19 pandemic

image.altText: A man in a green suit jacket smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A new survey by consumer advocates say getting out of a subscription for an online meal planning service or fitness app needs to be made easier, or illegal.

title.children: The Bachelor's fitness app under microscope in new 'subscription traps' survey

image.altText: Bill shorten wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The federal government has reached an agreement with the states and territories over plans to reform the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), putting an end to a prolonged stalemate.

title.children: States and territories to back major NDIS reforms as Senate vote looms

image.altText: Merle Thornton at the Regatta Hotel at Toowong in Brisbane

props.synopsis: In 1965 Merle Thornton AM and a friend chained themselves to a bar at the Regatta Hotel in Brisbane in protest of a ban on women drinking in public bars. It became regarded as a pivotal moment in women's liberation in Australia.

title.children: Merle Thornton, who fought for the right for women to drink at public bars in Queensland, dies aged 93

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to unveiling its plans for older Australians to pay more for their aged care, after months of closed-door negotiations with the Coalition.

title.children: Aged care residents to pay more as government grapples with quality and quantity

image.altText: A golden retriever sits as its owner attempts tom brush its teeth with a small toothbrush

props.synopsis: From toothpastes and toothbrushes to chews and toys, there are a range of at-home dental products for dogs. But what actually works to help prevent dental disease in your dog?

title.children: Vets no longer recommend bones, so how do you look after your dog's teeth?

image.altText: A pre-teen boy with dark hair looks at a smartphone with his head in one hand

props.synopsis: Lee's son was brutally cyberbullied. Here's how to help protect your child and support them through it if it happens.

title.children: Cyberbullying nearly killed Lee's son. Here's the expert advice she wishes she had

image.altText: An archive photo of a little girl smiling, wearing blue/grey overalls and a yellow turtleneck.

props.synopsis: A New Zealand woman and former member of a New South Wales-based cult has received a nine-year sentence over the 1987 manslaughter of her daughter, telling the court she will never forgive herself.

title.children: 'A wound that never heals': Former cult member given nine-year sentence over 1987 death of daughter

image.altText: 2003 photo shoot of The Mars Volta's curly-haired Omar Rodríguez-López and Cedric Bixler-Zavala

props.synopsis: Omar and Cedric tells the story of how childhood friends Omar Rodríguez-López and Cedric Bixler-Zavala overcame break-ups, addiction, loss and betrayal to make ferociously complex music.

title.children: The men behind two massive prog-rock bands are 'sort of naked' in this new rockumentary

image.altText: Tosin Cole as Michael, a very attractive Black man looking scared, his eyes are wide, and bloodshot, close up of face

props.synopsis: Supacell rose to the number one spot in Netflix's global TV series list and remained in the top 10 for six weeks. The show, in which five newly minted superheroes adjust to their new powers, is prompting important conversations about sickle cell disease.

title.children: Supacell praised for raising awareness of sickle cell disease. So, what is it?

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's lawyers have successfully argued for the accused murderer's Supreme Court trial next year not to take place in Melbourne, but in the Gippsland town of Morwell.

title.children: Erin Patterson's murder trial over the lunch deaths of three people will be held in regional Victoria

image.altText: A blue screened smartphone shows the swirly Disney+ logo with a screen behind it

props.synopsis: The company previously argued it could not be taken to court after the victim's husband took out a trial subscription to its streaming service, Disney+.

title.children: Disney drops attempt to avoid wrongful death lawsuit after backlash

image.altText: Mike Lynch smiles as he wears a suit and walks from the High Court.

props.synopsis: Their Italian holiday was meant to celebrate winning a mighty battle between corporate heavyweights, but the Bayesian luxury yacht was in "the wrong place at the wrong time".

title.children: A freak ocean phenomenon is being blamed for the sudden sinking of the luxury yacht Bayesian

image.altText: A shirtless man in a dark cap takes a selfie in a suburban yard.

props.synopsis: Wiradjuri man Dwayne Johnstone was fatally shot by a Corrective Services officer in Lismore in 2019. The Corrective Services officer who shot him was found not guilty of murder.

title.children: Urgent call for firearm review after shooting death of handcuffed man outside hospital

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: A prolonged downturn in China's property market will have significant flow-on effects for the Australian government's finances and the local steel industry, economists warn.

title.children: BlueScope Steel warns a 'large volume of steel' is leaving China and flooding markets in Australia and overseas

image.altText: a woman and dog look into each other's eyes

props.synopsis: Desperate to ease the agony she was in and regain her quality of life, Inez made the heartbreaking choice to lose her fertility. It might not even help.

title.children: Inez had a hysterectomy at 27 for the chance of a pain-free life. The devastating catch is it might not help
